title: Burial and Cremation Rights Act
decision_details: - Clarence of the Attorney General has been received for the Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman to make provisions to confer the right to every person to make a decision on the manner of disposing the body of such person after death and in case of death of a person who has not expressed the consent as to the manner of disposal of his body after death, to confer the next of kin of such person the right to decide whether the body of such person shall be buried or cremated, giving due consideration to the known preferences and religious, cultural or personal beliefs of the deceased. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to publish the Bill prepared accordingly in the Government Gazette and to submit the same thereafter to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.
